description: Originally designed as a bipedal scout robot for private contractors, the Newt has found a wide variety of uses both within the military and the civilian world. It's most famous fixture is its large bio-synthetic legs that constitute most of its mass. Those legs are for more than just walking though, a kick from a Newt can easily break a man's ribs.
A broken Newt Mk.I, now wrecked and motionless. Synthetic blood still oozes from its muscular legs. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive Newt Mk.I.

Originally designed as a bipedal scout robot for private contractors, the Newt has found a wide variety of uses both within the military and the civilian world. It's most famous fixture is its large bio-synthetic legs that constitute most of its mass. Those legs are for more than just walking though, a kick from a Newt can easily break a man's ribs. This variant has received a suite of upgrades, slightly improving its speed and damage resistance.
A broken Newt Mk.I, now wrecked and motionless. Synthetic blood still oozes from its muscular legs. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive Newt Mk.II.

Originally designed as a bipedal scout robot for private contractors, the Newt has found a wide variety of uses both within the military and the civilian world. It's most famous fixture is its large bio-synthetic legs that constitute most of its mass. Those legs are for more than just walking though, a kick from a Newt can easily break a man's ribs. This variant is designed for law enforcement purposes.
A broken police Newt, now wrecked and motionless. Synthetic blood still oozes from its muscular legs. It could be gutted for spare parts.

Originally designed as a bipedal scout robot for private contractors, the Newt has found a wide variety of uses both within the military and the civilian world. It's most famous fixture is its large bio-synthetic legs that constitute most of its mass. Those legs are for more than just walking though, a kick from a Newt can easily break a man's ribs. This variant is designed for military purposes and has a 9mm turret.
A broken Newt Mk.III, now wrecked and motionless. Synthetic blood still oozes from its muscular legs. It could be gutted for spare parts.

Originally designed as a bipedal scout robot for private contractors, the Newt has found a wide variety of uses both within the military and the civilian world. It's most famous fixture is its large bio-synthetic legs that constitute most of its mass. Those legs are for more than just walking though, a kick from a Newt can easily break a man's ribs. This variant is relatively rare, and uses a series of tentacles to subdue enemies.
A broken elite Newt, now wrecked and motionless. Synthetic blood still oozes from its muscular legs. It could be gutted for spare parts.

In a radical departure from form, New England Law enforcement decided to procure an overseas robotic frame with a far less disturbing appearance than their standard models. After seeking a variety of offers, The Chi Industries Model P-013 series service gynoid was chosen. Don't let their appearance fool you, these robots are no less dangerous than their less-humanoid counterparts. This one is equipped with a police baton.
A broken Police gynoid, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive Chi Industries police gynoid.

In a radical departure from form, New England Law enforcement decided to procure an overseas robotic frame with a far less disturbing appearance than their standard models. After seeking a variety of offers, The Chi Industries Model P-013 series service gynoid was chosen. Don't let their appearance fool you, these robots are no less dangerous than their less-humanoid counterparts. This one is equipped with a pistol.
A broken Police gynoid, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.

In a radical departure from form, New England Law enforcement decided to procure an overseas robotic frame with a far less disturbing appearance than their standard models. After seeking a variety of offers, The Chi Industries Model P-013 series service gynoid was chosen. Don't let their appearance fool you, these robots are no less dangerous than their less-humanoid counterparts. This one is equipped with a battering ram.
A broken SWAT gynoid, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.

In a radical departure from form, New England Law enforcement decided to procure an overseas robotic frame with a far less disturbing appearance than their standard models. After seeking a variety of offers, The Chi Industries Model P-013 series service gynoid was chosen. Don't let their appearance fool you, these robots are no less dangerous than their less-humanoid counterparts. This one is equipped with a riot shotgun.
A broken SWAT gynoid, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.

The P-73.2 Model gynoid is perhaps the most famous of all Chi industry gynoids in American domestic life. Designed as humanoid helpers for more delicate tasks such as culinary preparation, entertaining and advertising, these models quickly found their place in the medical health industry. Something must have went wrong during the cataclysm though, as they now perceive most people as being potential intruders. This variant has a scalpel.
A broken nurse gynoid, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive Chi Industries nurse gynoid.

The P-73.2 Model gynoid is perhaps the most famous of all Chi industry gynoids in American domestic life. Designed as humanoid helpers for more delicate tasks such as culinary preparation, entertaining and advertising, these models quickly found their place in the medical health industry. Something must have went wrong during the cataclysm though, as they now perceive most people as being potential intruders. This variant has an injector.
A broken nurse gynoid, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.

The P-73.2 Model gynoid is perhaps the most famous of all Chi industry gynoids in American domestic life. Designed as humanoid helpers for more delicate tasks such as culinary preparation, entertaining and advertising, these models quickly found their place in the medical health industry. Something must have went wrong during the cataclysm though, as they now perceive most people as being potential intruders. This variant has a powerful auto-doc arm to assist in surgery and hauling of medical items.
A broken nurse gynoid, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.

The P-73.2 Model gynoid is perhaps the most famous of all Chi industry gynoids in American domestic life. Designed as humanoid helpers for more delicate tasks such as culinary preparation, entertaining and advertising, these models quickly found their place in the medical health industry. Something must have went wrong during the cataclysm though, as they now perceive most people as being potential intruders. This variant has a powerful chemical injector to assist in sanitizing toxic environments.
A broken nurse gynoid, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.

The Chi Industries Utili-bot was designed as the famous consumer electronics company's first foray into consumer robotics. Around the size of a family dog, the Utilibot was intended as a general purpose platform for domestic duties, daily chores and even companionship (although that wasn't very likely). The Utili-bot was a product that divided people into two camps: either you saw the robot as a decadent pile of electronic trash, or as an invaluable and tireless servant.
A broken Utili-bot, now wrecked and motionless. Synthetic blood still oozes from its muscular legs. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive Utili-bot.
A large plastic box the size of a human with a transparent lid facing towards the user. Contained within is a single Chi Industries Utili-bot.

The Chi Industries Utili-bot was designed as the famous consumer electronics company's first foray into consumer robotics. Around the size of a family dog, the Utilibot was intended as a general purpose platform for domestic duties, daily chores and even companionship (although that wasn't very likely). The Utili-bot was a product that divided people into two camps: either you saw the robot as a decadent pile of electronic trash, or as an invaluable and tireless servant. This one is equipped with .45acp caliber gun turret.
A broken Utili-bot, now wrecked and motionless. Synthetic blood still oozes from its muscular legs. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive gun Utili-bot.

The Chi Industries City Utili-bot was designed as the famous consumer electronics company's first foray into consumer robotics. Around the size of a family dog, the Utilibot was intended as a general purpose platform for domestic duties, daily chores and even companionship (although that wasn't very likely). The Utili-bot was a product that divided people into two camps: either you saw the robot as a decadent pile of electronic trash, or as an invaluable and tireless servant. This one is outfitted with a powerful arm for melee combat.
A melee Utili-bot, now wrecked and motionless. Synthetic blood still oozes from its muscular legs. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive melee Utili-bot.

The ZX-19 is a chinese military drone designed for use as an automated platoon-level logistics and auxilliary support platform. Similar to its american counterpart, it took design cues from nature, and features four stout legs to help it trot around the field of battle. This particular variant is equipped with a 9mm gun turret. How it was deployed to New England, and exactly when, is unknown.
A broken Newt ZX-19, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.

The Zhuazi N-1 is a unmanned ground vehicle that was rumored to exist on the dark corners of internet before the Cataclysm, confirmed to be very real only relatively recently. When they are not deployed, Zhuazi drones look similar to large ballistic shells, and only deploy their legs after they've impacted the ground after falling in a ballistic arc from beyond the horizon. The mechanical feet act as spades, and are also sufficiently sharp to damage any would-be assailant.
A broken Zhuazi N-1, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive Zhuazi N-1.

The Zhuazi N-E is a unmanned suicide vehicle that was rumored to exist on the dark corners of internet before the Cataclysm, confirmed to be very real only relatively recently. When they are not deployed, Zhuazi drones look similar to large ballistic shells, and only deploy their legs after they've impacted the ground after falling in a ballistic arc from beyond the horizon. The mechanical feet act as spades, and are also sufficiently sharp to damage any would-be assailant. Beware! This variant is designed to explode upon contact with an enemy.
A broken Zhuazi N-E, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
A special, rare variant of the Zhuazi designed for covert operations. Its exterior consists of a crude optical camouflage that obscures line of sight in low-light conditions.
A broken Zhuazi N-2, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
A special, electrostatic variant of the Zhuazi designed for covert operations. A section was removed from the top of the UGV to accomodate an electricity-projecting weapon.
A broken Zhuazi N-3, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive Zhuazi N-3.
A ranged combat variant of the Zhuazi unmanned combat platform. Features a turret firing an intermediate cartridge.
A broken Zhuazi N-R, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive Zhuazi N-R.
A special, rare variant of the Zhuazi designed for biological warfare purposes. Features a large storage tank for caustic fluid to be shot out of a pressurized nozzle.
A broken Zhuazi N-Ac, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive Zhuazi N-Ac.

A domestic maid robot designed by the famous Japanese company, Chi Industries. Although these were held in high esteem before the cataclysm for their ability to do household chores, they were rather expensive and only sold at proprietary Chi Industries stores.
A broken maid persobot, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive maid persobot.

A companion robot designed by the famous Japanese company, Chi Industries. Although these were held in high esteem before the cataclysm for their ability to act as a household companion, they were rather expensive and only sold at proprietary Chi Industries stores.
A broken persocom, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive maid persobot.

An android placed in a replica suit of medieval armor, equipped with a longsword as well. Once a well-loved attraction in museums across New England, these replicas of knights of yore have turned hostile.
A broken knight reenactor bot, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.

A Chi Industries gynoid designed for use as a waitress in the Dawson convienence store and family restaurant. Dawson, being a Japanese company that only recently opened up shop in America, decided to use these artificial gynoids to cut down on operating costs and differentiate themselves from standard American rest stops.
A broken persocom, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
The Google Store Assistance Utility Platform, a robot designed for stocking shelves and identifying shoplifters in New England's larger store chains.
A broken store assistance robot, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.

Originally designed as a bipedal scout robot for private contractors, the Newt has found a wide variety of uses both within the military and the civilian world. It's most famous fixture is its large bio-synthetic legs that constitute most of its mass. Those legs are for more than just walking though, a kick from a Newt can easily break a man's ribs. This variant has been deployed by XEDRA, seemingly after the cataclysm was well underway. It is equipped with deployable blades on its mechanical feet, giving it extra cutting damage.
A broken XEDRA Newt Mk.I, now wrecked and motionless. Synthetic blood still oozes from its muscular legs. It could be gutted for spare parts.
A large plastic box the size of a human with a transparent lid facing towards the user. Contained within is a single Chi-Industries persobot.
A large plastic box the size of a human with a transparent lid facing towards the user. Contained within is a single Chi-Industries police gynoid.
A large plastic box the size of a human with a transparent lid facing towards the user. Contained within is a single Chi-Industries persocom.
A persocom designed for private security and protection by Chi Industries. Carries a .45acp handgun.
A broken combat persocom, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
A large plastic box the size of a human with a transparent lid facing towards the user. Contained within is a single Chi-Industries combat persocom.
An inactive combat persocom
A large plastic box the size of a human with a transparent lid facing towards the user. Contained within is a single Newt Mk.I .
A large plastic box the size of a human with a transparent lid facing towards the user. Contained within is a single Chi-Industries nursebot.

The Zhuazi N-1 is a unmanned ground vehicle that was rumored to exist on the dark corners of internet before the Cataclysm, confirmed to be very real only relatively recently. When they are not deployed, Zhuazi drones look similar to large ballistic shells, and only deploy their legs after they've impacted the ground after falling in a ballistic arc from beyond the horizon. The mechanical feet act as spades, and are also sufficiently sharp to damage any would-be assailant. The N-1b variant was designed to be more versatile than its cheaper cousin, allowing it to be upgraded into a wide variety of forms at Chinese drop pods.
A broken Zhuazi N-1a, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive Zhuazi N-1a.

The Zhuazi M-1 is a unmanned ground vehicle that was rumored to exist on the dark corners of internet before the Cataclysm, confirmed to be very real only relatively recently. When they are not deployed, Zhuazi drones look similar to large ballistic shells, and only deploy their legs after they've impacted the ground after falling in a ballistic arc from beyond the horizon. The mechanical feet act as spades, and are also sufficiently sharp to damage any would-be assailant. The M-1 variant was designed to be an upgraded version of the N-1, with increased armor plating and structural redundancies.
A broken Zhuazi M-1, now wrecked and motionless. It could be gutted for spare parts.
An inactive Zhuazi M-1.
